DOC.detailed_description: This two-phase study randomize control trial ( RCT ) compare usual care 12-month peer-led DSMS intervention design improve long-term diabetes-related health outcome . In Phase 1 , research team implement 30-hour peer leader training ( PLT ) program recruiting adult type 2 diabetes equip diabetes knowledge , facilitation strategy , communication skill deliver DSMS intervention . In Phase 2 , researcher conduct peer support intervention , refer Peer-Led , Empowerment-based Approach Self-management Efforts Diabetes ( PLEASED ) . Patients randomize PLEASED arm pair peer leader receive 12 weekly contact ( face-to-face telephone support ) peer leader ( PL ) first 3 month follow 18 bi-weekly telephone support contact last 9 month . The goal PLEASED intervention help patient improve glycemic control diabetes specific QOL sustain health benefit long-term . To achieve goal , PLs address 3 key function peer support include assist patient daily management diabetes , provide social emotional support , link patient clinical care resource . Participants ' inclusion criterion : ( 1 ) type 2 diabetes , ( 2 ) 21 year , ( 3 ) speak English Vietnamese language peer leader speak , ( 4 ) willing match peer leader , ( 5 ) personal land line telephone mobile phone . Peer leader ' inclusion criterion : ( 1 ) diabetes , ( 2 ) 21 year , ( 3 ) speak English , ( 4 ) transportation attend training , ( 5 ) willing commit 30-hour training program , ( 6 ) land line telephone mobile phone ( 7 ) self-reported HbA1c 8 % less .
